definitions.definition: having the qualities that deserve somebody/something

examples.text: Very few of his ideas are worthy of further attention.
A number of the report's findings are **worthy of note**.
No composer was considered worthy of the name until he had written an opera.
a worthy champion *(= one who deserved to win)*
He felt he was not worthy of her.
The matter is hardly worthy of the managing director's time.
In Mason we have a worthy new champion.
Several of our members are worthy of particular mention.
She felt she was not worthy to be on the stage with all these glamorous people.

definitions.definition: having qualities that deserve your respect or attention

examples.text: The money we raise will be going to a very **worthy cause**.
a worthy member of the team
We thought it was a worthy enough objective.

definitions.definition: having good qualities but not very interesting or exciting

examples.text: He's a very worthy man, I suppose, but he's very dull.

definitions.definition: typical of what a particular person or thing might do, give, etc.

examples.text: He gave a speech that was worthy of Martin Luther King.

definitions.definition: deserving, or suitable for, the thing mentioned
